courses.description: Through a few selected important topics, this course examines how environmental factors impact the health of people and the community, and what we can do to prevent or minimize the negative impacts.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health
courses.course_syllabus:
| ***Basics of Environmental Health**: (History and definition of environmental health and occupational health; toxicology & epidemiology methods used to assess the impact of environmental exposures on human health)* | |
| --- | --- |
| ***Natural environment, climate change and health:** (Adverse health effects within the natural environment, particularly in developing countries; health outcomes linked to climate change.)* | |
| |
| ***Air pollution and health**: (The typical components of urban ambient air pollution and their corresponding health effects.)* | |
| |
| ***Water and food safety:** (Hazardous substances that may be found in drinking water and in the food supply; water & food safety control measures)* | |
| |
| ***Solid and hazardous waste** : (Hazards of poorly designed solid waste disposal sites & improperly processed sewage.)* | |
| |
| ***Work and health** (fundamental of occupational health, principles of preventing occupational diseases and injuries)* | |
| |
| ***O****ccupational disease and** **injury** (fundamental concepts related to occupational disease and injury, introduction to pneumoconiosis)* | |
| |
| ***Risk management and environmental health policy**: (The steps in the risk-assessment and risk-management processes; principles that guide environmental policy development; environmental health regulation.)* | |
| |
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: * **1)** Living with the Earth: Concepts in Environmental Health Science. Moore, G. S. Boca Raton: Lewis Publishers. 2) Essentials of Environmental Health. Robert H. Friis.Sudbury, Mass. Jones and Bartlett, c2007;*

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Lecture series on Occupational Health
courses.description: A basic course for students intending to study in any discipline of occupational health. General basic principles of controls of hazards in the practice of occupational health and hygiene will be introduced. Other topics include chemical hazards, physical hazards, biological hazards, ergonomics, injury and return to work, workplace wellness, as well as common occupational diseases and challenges in Hong Kong.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students will be able to do the following:
• Describe the common occupational health risks caused by biological, chemical, physical, and ergonomics.
• Recognize work injury and return-to-work, occupational health surveillance, workplace wellness, common occupational diseases and challenges in Hong Kong.
• Acquire knowledge of current regulatory and policy issues related to occupational health.
• Apply principles in the practice of occupational health and hygiene to controls of hazards in the workplace as well as environmental health protection to the community.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Introduction to Occupational Health & Hygiene | |
| --- | --- |
| Chemical Hazards (Gases & Vapours, Organic Compounds, and Metals) *HW#1 Assigned on Jan 31. (SK will mark)* | |
| |
| |
| Dust Hazards and Biological Hazards | |
| Physical Hazards I (Noise and vibration) *HW #1 due (SK will mark)* | |
| Physical Hazards II (radiation, pressure, heat, lighting) *HW#2 Assigned (ST will mark)* | |
| Ergonomics | |
| Control of Hazard, Occupational Exposure Limits, and Instrumentation *HW #2 due (ST will mark)* | |
| **Site Visit 2:00-5:00pm** Submit individual HHE report two weeks after site visit *(TW will mark the HHE report)* | |
| Injury and Return to Work *HW#3 Assigned (Joan Fok will mark)* | |
| *Framework of occupational health surveillance & Workplace wellness* | |
| Occupational diseases and challenges in HK | |

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Occupational Health II (OM)
courses.description: This is a follow-up of course "Occupational Health I" for medical doctors who want to specialize in the discipline of occupational medicine. A systematic approach to the study of occupational diseases and work-related health problem will be introduced, and practical management problems in occupational medicine will be covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes: Recognition of occupational diseases and managing occupational health problems and services

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Occupational Health II (Hygiene)
courses.description: This is a follow-up of course "Occupational Health I" for students who want to specialize in the discipline of occupational hygiene. A systematic approach to the anticipation, recognition, evaluation and control of occupational hazards will be introduced and practical experience with instrumentation in the assessment of the working environment will be emphasised.

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Occupational Health II (Health Practice)
courses.description: This is a follow-up of course "Occupational Health I" for nurses who want to specialize in the discipline of occupational health nursing and occupational health practice. Common and important occupational diseases and work-related health problems will be introduced as well as the importance of health promotion in the workplace. Practical aspects in occupational health practice will be emphasised.

courses.title: Air Pollution

Professor HO Kin Fai

Professor CHUNG Ming Kei,

Professor CHUNG Ming Kei,

courses.description: This course introduces the current state of knowledge in the key areas in which air pollutants impact on the health of the general population. Topics include the health impacts of gaseous air pollutants such as sulfur dioxide, nitrogen dioxide, carbon monoxide and ozone; mechanism of lung injury by airborne particulate matter; epidemiological evidence of the risk from particulate matter exposure; airborne chemical carcinogens; health effects of indoor air pollution; and setting health-based air quality standards.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
Student should be able to:
1. Describe the importance of outdoor and indoor air pollution and its impact on human health
2. Discuss and distinguish the various source of air borne chemical pollutants and its potential health outcomes
3. Explain the major source of work related air pollutants and its effect
4. Understand the process of setting air quality standard
5. Understand the entire air quality management process of Hong Kong
courses.course_syllabus:
This course introduces the current state of knowledge in the key areas in which air pollutants impact on the health of the
general population. Topics include the health impacts of gaseous air pollutants such as sulfur dioxide, nitrogen dioxide,
carbon monoxide and ozone; mechanism of lung injury by airborne particulate matter; epidemiological evidence of the risk
from particulate matter exposure; airborne chemical carcinogens; health effects of indoor air pollution; and setting health-based air quality standards.

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Water and Health
courses.description: This is a 2-credit course for graduate students. This course give a brief introduction to water, environment, and health.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
Student should be able to:

1. Describe the importance of water cycle, and reasons for scarcity of water

2. Understand importance of water in human health

3. Understand effects of heavy metal poisoning from industrial and agricultural pollution

4. Understand the differences in focus and practice of water regulation across the globe
courses.course_syllabus:
| Introduction: water cycle and water scarcity |
| --- |
| Water-related hazards and sources of exposure |
| Water supply and drinking water quality assessment |
| Industrial and agriculture exposure to chemicals |
| Water regulation in different countries |
| Water sampling and analysis |
| Waste water treatment |
| Final presentation |
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Public Health Toxicology
courses.description:
This course provides students with the basic concepts of toxicology and its application to environmental, occupational, nutrition and food toxicology; discusses distribution, cellular penetration, metabolic conversion, and elimination of toxic agents, as well as the fundamental laws governing the interaction of foreign chemicals with biological systems; focuses on the application of these concepts to the understanding the result from environmental exposure to toxic substances through a case study format.
[students are required to have good knowledge on biology and health or have taken PBHT5005 Basic Human Physiology]
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students will be able to do the following:
1. Describe the chemical properties and the biological processes which modulate the toxicokinetics of chemical agents of public health importance.
2. Explain the significance of biotransformation reactions as a determinant of the toxicokinetic and toxicodynamic activities of chemicals.
3. Describe pathophysiological responses resulting from exposure to chemical agents relevant to human health.
4. Identify underlying susceptibility factors which contribute to the ability of chemicals to elicit bioeffects which contribute to human disease.
5. Explain the science underlying testing for the ability of chemicals to elicit adverse human health effects.
6. Put into perspective the role of toxicology in the risk assessment process.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Overview and concepts of public health toxicology
- General principles of environmental toxicology
- Environmental Carcinogenesis, Cancer Biomarkers and Susceptibility Factors
- Case study of organ toxicology
- Toxicity of metal and Persistent Organic Pollutants (dioxin – breast milk)
- Visit [Toxicology reference laboratory]
- Nutritional toxicology [tutorial]
- Occupational toxicology [tutorial]
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Environmental Risk Assessment
courses.description:
This course provides students with an understanding of the role and scope of health risk assessment, the application of toxicology, epidemiology, exposure assessment and environmental monitoring in risk assessment, risk characterization and risk management.
[students should also take OENV 5009– Public Health Toxicology]
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.course_syllabus:
Overview of risk assessment in public health.
- Toxicology in health risk assessment
- Exposure assessment and biological monitoring (biomarkers, genetics) in health risk assessment
- Role of epidemiology in risk assessment (Dose-response relationship)
- Case study analysis (linkage amongst animal study in the lab, epi results in the general population, epi data of workers)
- Risk characterization and conceptual model development
- Risk management, risk communication and challenges
- Group work and case study development of a risk assessment [recent episodes of public health issue – air, water, food, soil].
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Environmental Risk Management and Communication
courses.description: This module builds upon the principles taught in OENV 5010 (Environmental Risk Assessment). The course gives students basic knowledge of the frameworks used for risk reduction and the protection of human health from chemical, physical, biological and ergonomic hazards. Students will be exposed to environmental risk communication frameworks and practical guidance on report writing for stakeholders and for future policy formulation.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students should be able to:
1) Describe different approaches for preventing, and managing biological, chemical, physical and ergonomic
hazards that pose risks to human health and safety
2) Be able to demonstrate an understanding of the decision process behind the management of environmental
and infectious disease risks and provide justification for the prioritisation of different risk management actions
3) Describe methods for risk reduction & control for chemical, physical, biological and ergonomic hazards at local
and international levels
4) Be able to formulate preventive action and risk control programs including programs for surveillance
5) Describe the roles of risk communication in environmental health and its role in the policy process
6) Be able to provide appropriate suggestions for communication of assessment and management of environmental risks and be able to identify how perceived risk, values, politics, ethics and culture influence the approaches used to manage environmental health risk
courses.course_syllabus:
| Introduction and Principle of Risk Management |
| --- |
| Risk Management for Biological/ Infectious disease Hazards |
| Risk Management for Physical Hazards |
| *Risk Management for Chemical Hazards* |
| *Risk Management for Occupational Health & Ergonomics* |
| Introduction to Risk Communications |
| Risk Communication |
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Blumenthal UJ., Fleisher JM, Esrey SA, Peasey A. Epidemiology: a tool for the assessment of risk. In Water Quality: Guidelines, Standards and Health: Assessment of Risk and Risk Management for Water-Related Infectious Disease. World Health Organization.2001, IWA Publishing. (http://whqlibdoc.who.int/publications/2001/924154533X\_chap7.pdf) 2. Haas C,

2. Eisenberg JNS. Risk Assessment. In Water Quality: Guidelines, Standards and Health: Assessment of Risk and Risk Management for Water-Related Infectious Disease. World Health Organization.2001, IWA Publishing. (http://whqlibdoc.who.int/publications/2001/924154533X\_chap8.pdf)

3. Food & drink : good manufacturing practice : a guide to its responsible management

4. HACCP / Sara Mortimore and Carol Wallace ; compiling editor, Christos Cassianos

5. The ISO 9000 quality system : applications in food and technology

6. Food safety in China : a comprehensive review / Linhai Wu, Dian Zhu

7. JimÈnez B och Rose J. (Eds.) Urban water security: Managing risks, Urban Water Series, UNESCOIHP, Taylor and Francis ISBN 9780415485678 (selected parts )

courses.subject: OENV
courses.title: Injury prevention and control
courses.description: This course aims to provide students with an understanding that injury is a public health issue of global importance, the burden of injury to society, and strategies currently in place to prevent injury of different causes. The course includes the definition of injury, measurement and classification of injury, assessment of injury severity, risk factors identification for various types of injury, concept of prevention, intervention strategies and their evaluation, and cause-specific injury topics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students under School of Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes: After completion of the module, student be understanding the basic principles and issues of Injury prevention and control.
courses.course_syllabus: Please refer to the course outline provided by course teacher
